content.title: Incentives for Meritorious Children (Students) of Workers (10th and 12th Class) (HBOCWWB)
content.details: The scheme 'Incentives for Meritorious Children (Students) of Workers (10th and 12th Class)' is implemented by the Haryana Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (HBOCWWB). Under this scheme, a scholarship (prize money) in the form of a fixed deposit will be provided to meritorious children of construction workers who have achieved academic excellence in the Class X/XII examination. Registered workers with a one-year regular membership are eligible to apply for benefits for up to three of their children.
eligibility: The applicant should be engaged in building or construction work.
The applicants should be registered with the Haryana Building & Other Construction Workers Welfare Board.
The registered worker must have a minimum of one year of regular membership.
The worker must have an active membership with the Board.
The scholarship (prize money) will be provided to meritorious children of construction workers who have achieved academic excellence in the Class X/XII examination.
The incentive amount will be payable for up to three children.
documents_required: Identity proof i.e. Aadhaar Card, Voter Card

faqs.question: What is the aim of the scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme aims to provide scholarships (prize money) in the form of fixed deposits to meritorious children of construction workers who have excelled academically in Class X or XII.

faqs.question: Who implements the scheme?
faqs.answer: The scheme is implemented by the Haryana Building and Other Construction Workers Welfare Board (HBOCWWB), Labour Department, Government of Haryana.

faqs.question: What are the benefits offered under this scheme?
faqs.answer: Scholarships/prize money are provided as follows: 1. 90% and above: ₹51,000/- 2. 80% and above: ₹41,000/- 3. 70% and above: ₹31,000/- 4. 60% and above: ₹21,000/-

faqs.question: Who is eligible to apply for this scheme?
faqs.answer: Children of construction workers registered with HBOCWWB with at least one year of regular membership.

faqs.question: How many children per family can receive the scholarship?
faqs.answer: Benefits can be applied for up to three children per registered worker.

faqs.question: What academic performance is required to receive the scholarship?
faqs.answer: Children must have achieved at least 60% marks in their Class X or XII examinations.

faqs.question: How is the scholarship amount provided?
faqs.answer: The scholarship is given in the form of a fixed deposit.

faqs.question: Where can workers register for the scheme?
faqs.answer: Workers can register on the official website of the Labour Department Haryana.

faqs.question: What is the minimum duration of membership required to be eligible?
faqs.answer: A minimum of one-year regular membership with HBOCWWB is required.

faqs.question: How can a worker apply for the scholarship?
faqs.answer: By visiting the official website of the Labour Department Haryana.
